trans-unit.source: Retrieves operating statistics for a server

seg-source.mrk: Retrieves operating statistics for a server

target.mrk: Retrieves operating statistics for a server

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies the DNS or NetBIOS name of the remote server on which the function is to execute.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the DNS or NetBIOS name of the remote server on which the function is to execute.

target.mrk: Specifies the DNS or NetBIOS name of the remote server on which the function is to execute.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is blank, the local computer is used.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is blank, the local computer is used.

target.mrk: If this parameter is blank, the local computer is used.

trans-unit.source: an array with the following format:

seg-source.mrk: an array with the following format:

target.mrk: an array with the following format:

trans-unit.source: [ 0] - Indicates the time when statistics collection started.

seg-source.mrk: [ 0] - Indicates the time when statistics collection started.

target.mrk: [ 0] - Indicates the time when statistics collection started.

trans-unit.source: The value is stored as the number of seconds that have elapsed since 00:00:00, January 1, 1970, GMT.

seg-source.mrk: The value is stored as the number of seconds that have elapsed since 00:00:00, January 1, 1970, GMT.

target.mrk: The value is stored as the number of seconds that have elapsed since 00:00:00, January 1, 1970, GMT.

trans-unit.source: [ 1] - Indicates the number of times a file is opened on a server

seg-source.mrk: [ 1] - Indicates the number of times a file is opened on a server

target.mrk: [ 1] - Indicates the number of times a file is opened on a server

trans-unit.source: [ 2] - Indicates the number of times a server device is opened

seg-source.mrk: [ 2] - Indicates the number of times a server device is opened

target.mrk: [ 2] - Indicates the number of times a server device is opened

trans-unit.source: [ 3] - Indicates the number of server print jobs spooled

seg-source.mrk: [ 3] - Indicates the number of server print jobs spooled

target.mrk: [ 3] - Indicates the number of server print jobs spooled

trans-unit.source: [ 4] - Indicates the number of times the server session started

seg-source.mrk: [ 4] - Indicates the number of times the server session started

target.mrk: [ 4] - Indicates the number of times the server session started

trans-unit.source: [ 5] - Indicates the number of times the server session disconnected

seg-source.mrk: [ 5] - Indicates the number of times the server session disconnected

target.mrk: [ 5] - Indicates the number of times the server session disconnected

trans-unit.source: [ 6] - Indicates the number of times the server sessions failed with error

seg-source.mrk: [ 6] - Indicates the number of times the server sessions failed with error

target.mrk: [ 6] - Indicates the number of times the server sessions failed with error

trans-unit.source: [ 7] - Indicates the number of server password violations

seg-source.mrk: [ 7] - Indicates the number of server password violations

target.mrk: [ 7] - Indicates the number of server password violations

trans-unit.source: [ 8] - Indicates the number of server access permission errors

seg-source.mrk: [ 8] - Indicates the number of server access permission errors

target.mrk: [ 8] - Indicates the number of server access permission errors

trans-unit.source: [ 9] - Indicates the number of server system errors

seg-source.mrk: [ 9] - Indicates the number of server system errors

target.mrk: [ 9] - Indicates the number of server system errors

trans-unit.source: [10] - Number of server bytes sent to the network

seg-source.mrk: [10] - Number of server bytes sent to the network

target.mrk: [10] - Number of server bytes sent to the network

trans-unit.source: [11] - Number of server bytes received from the network

seg-source.mrk: [11] - Number of server bytes received from the network

target.mrk: [11] - Number of server bytes received from the network

trans-unit.source: [12] - Indicates the average server response time (in milliseconds)

seg-source.mrk: [12] - Indicates the average server response time (in milliseconds)

target.mrk: [12] - Indicates the average server response time (in milliseconds)

trans-unit.source: [13] - Indicates the number of times the server required a request buffer but failed to allocate one

seg-source.mrk: [13] - Indicates the number of times the server required a request buffer but failed to allocate one

target.mrk: [13] - Indicates the number of times the server required a request buffer but failed to allocate one

trans-unit.source: [14] - Indicates the number of times the server required a big buffer but failed to allocate one

seg-source.mrk: [14] - Indicates the number of times the server required a big buffer but failed to allocate one

target.mrk: [14] - Indicates the number of times the server required a big buffer but failed to allocate one

trans-unit.source: No special group membership is required to obtain workstation statistics.

seg-source.mrk: No special group membership is required to obtain workstation statistics.

target.mrk: No special group membership is required to obtain workstation statistics.

trans-unit.source: Only members of the Administrators or Server Operators local group can successfully execute this function on a remote server.

seg-source.mrk: Only members of the Administrators or Server Operators local group can successfully execute this function on a remote server.

target.mrk: Only members of the Administrators or Server Operators local group can successfully execute this function on a remote server.
